In biochemistry, a 'kinase' is a type of enzyme
that transfers phosphate groups from high-energy donor molecules, such as ATP, [http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/chemistry/laureates/1997/illpres/histor-
y.html] History of ATP research milestones from an ATP-related chemistry Nobel
Prize site. to specific substrates, a process referred to as
[[phosphorylation]]. Kinases are part of the larger family of
phosphotransferases. Kinases are not to be confused with phosphorylases, which
carry out phosphorolysis, the breaking of a bond using an inorganic phosphate
group; or with phosphatases, which remove phosphate groups.
